title: Find related rate of hypotentuse of a triangle

content.description: An isosceles right triangle with legs of length s has area <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <msup> <mi>s</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BA5@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. At the instant when <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt> <mrow> <mn>32</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39C5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> centimeters, the area of the triangle is increasing at a rate of 12 square centimeters per second.
content.question: At what rate is the length of the hypotenuse of the triangle increasing, in centimeters per second, at that instant?

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
